title: How to Make Smorgasbord Meatballs

steps.headline: Add 1 tablespoon butter to skillet.
steps.description: Melt the butter over low heat.

steps.headline: Add the minced onion and cook until tender.
steps.description: This should take a couple minutes.

steps.headline: Add the breadcrumbs to a large mixing bowl.
Add the water to the bread crumbs and mix to combine.
steps.description: Let the mixture stand a couple minutes. This step is important as if you do not do this, the meatballs will fall apart.

steps.headline: Add the beef, pork, cooked minced onion, spices and sugar.
Mix the meat and spice mixture until light and fluffy.
Add enough butter to lightly coat a large skillet.
steps.description: Melt the butter over low heat.

steps.headline: Spoon the meat mixture onto a clean cutting board.
Flatten the meat mixture evenly on the cutting board.
Cut the meat mixture into 50 squares.
Dip your hands in cold water and then shape each square into a meatball.
steps.description: Use a light touch to make the meatballs so they will come out light and tender. The meatballs may not be perfectly round.

steps.headline: Add the shaped meatballs to the melted butter and cook over medium heat.
Brown the meatballs over medium heat and then allow the meatballs to drain on paper towels.
Shake the pan while cooking the meatballs to help keep the meatballs round.
Fry the meatballs in batches, if needed.
Remove the meatballs from the skillet and keep warm.
Add the beef broth to the skillet once all the meatballs have finished cooking.
Cook the beef broth until thick and syrupy.
Pour the beef broth over the meatballs.
Serve over mashed potatoes or serve as an appetizer.

text: Add 1 tablespoon butter to skillet. Melt the butter over low heat. Add the minced onion and cook until tender. This should take a couple minutes. Add the breadcrumbs to a large mixing bowl.  Add the water to the bread crumbs and mix to combine. Let the mixture stand a couple minutes. This step is important as if you do not do this, the meatballs will fall apart. Add the beef, pork, cooked minced onion, spices and sugar.  Mix the meat and spice mixture until light and fluffy. This should take about 10 minutes. Add enough butter to lightly coat a large skillet. Melt the butter over low heat. Spoon the meat mixture onto a clean cutting board.  Flatten the meat mixture evenly on the cutting board.  Cut the meat mixture into 50 squares.  Dip your hands in cold water and then shape each square into a meatball. Use a light touch to make the meatballs so they will come out light and tender. The meatballs may not be perfectly round. Add the shaped meatballs to the melted butter and cook over medium heat.  Brown the meatballs over medium heat and then allow the meatballs to drain on paper towels.  Shake the pan while cooking the meatballs to help keep the meatballs round.  Fry the meatballs in batches, if needed.  Remove the meatballs from the skillet and keep warm.  Add the beef broth to the skillet once all the meatballs have finished cooking.  Cook the beef broth until thick and syrupy.  Pour the beef broth over the meatballs.  Serve over mashed potatoes or serve as an appetizer.
